Package de.nqueensfaf

Class Solver

java.lang.Object
de.nqueensfaf.Solver
Direct Known Subclasses:
CpuSolver, GpuSolver, SolverTest.MockSolver
public abstract class Solver extends Object

Abstract class for implementing Solvers.

To implement an own solver for the n queens problem, simply create a class that extends this one. Then the solver will automatically have the util functions like adding callbacks etc. and the given basic solver class structure makes it easier.

Author:
olepo

  • Method Details

    • run

      protected abstract void run()
      Solves the N-Queens Problem.

    • store

      public abstract void store(String filepath) throws IOException
      Saves the current progress of the Solver in a file so that it can be continued at some time later.
      Parameters:
      filename - name of the file the progress should be written in (existent or non existent)
      Throws:
      IOException

    • restore

      public abstract void restore(String filepath) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException, ClassCastException
      Reads the progress of an old run of the Solver and restores this state so that it can be continued.
      Parameters:
      filename - name of the file the progress was written in
      Throws:
      IOException
      ClassNotFoundException
      ClassCastException

    • isRestored

      public abstract boolean isRestored()
      States if the Solver has been restored and therefore contains restored values.
      Returns:
      true if restore() was called and the Solver was not started or resetted since, otherwise false

    • reset

      public abstract void reset()
      Resets the Solver; therefore, applies default values to all Solver state and progress related variables.

    • getDuration

      public abstract long getDuration()
      Gets the total runtime of the Solver in the current run.
      Returns:
      total runtime of the current run or 0 if the Solver is currently not running

    • getProgress

      public abstract float getProgress()
      Gets the percentage of the Solver's task that is completed.
      Returns:
      percentage of the Solver's task that is completed

    • getSolutions

      public abstract long getSolutions()
      Gets the current count of found solutions.
      Returns:
      current count of found solutions

    • solve

      public final void solve()
      Calls all initialization callbacks, then starts the Solver's run()-method, then calls all termination callbacks.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the time limit is exceeded while waiting for the Solverthread to shutdown after terminating (time limit is the bigger one of progressUpdateDelay and timeUpdateDelay)
      See Also:
      • #checkForPrepation()
      • run()

    • solveAsync

      public final void solveAsync()
      Asynchronously starts the Solver using a new thread and then waits till the Solver is successfully started.
      See Also:
      • solve()

    • waitFor

      public final void waitFor() throws InterruptedException
      Waits for the asynchronously running Solver to finish.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException
      See Also:
      • solveAsync()

    • checkForPreparation

      private void checkForPreparation()
      Checks if all prepartions are done correctly. * @throws IllegalStateException if N equals 0, the Solver is already running or if getProgress() >= 100

    • startUpdateCallerThreads

      private void startUpdateCallerThreads()
      Starts the threads that continously update the Solver's duration and progress using the related delay. The threads run until the Solver is finished.
      See Also:
      • timeUpdateDelay
      • progressUpdateDelay

    • addInitializationCallback

      public final Solver addInitializationCallback(Runnable r)
      Adds a callback that will be executed on start of the Solver. The callbacks will be called in reversed insertion order. Chainable.
      Parameters:
      r - the callback as Runnable
      Returns:
      the Solver
      See Also:
      • solve()

    • addTerminationCallback

      public final Solver addTerminationCallback(Runnable r)
      Adds a callback that will be executed on finish of the Solver. The callbacks will be called in reversed insertion order. Chainable.
      Parameters:
      r - the callback as Runnable
      Returns:
      the Solver
      See Also:
      • solve()

    • initializationCaller

      private void initializationCaller()
      Calls all initialization callbacks in reversed insertion order.

    • terminationCaller

      private void terminationCaller()
      Calls all termination callbacks in reversed insertion order.
